PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_ControllerTypeTwoPosition
PropertySetDef.Definition: Properties for signal handling for an analog controller taking disparate valued multiple inputs and creating a single valued binary output. HISTORY: In IFC4, extended properties to replace Pset_BinaryInput and Pset_BinaryOutput.

PropertyDef.Name: ControlType
PropertyDef.Definition: The type of signal modification effected and applicable ports:\X\0D \X\0D LOWERLIMITSWITCH: Single analog input is read and if less than Value.LowerBound then True is written to the output value.\X\0D UPPERLIMITSWITCH: Single analog input is read and if more than Value.UpperBound then True is written to the output value.\X\0D LOWERBANDSWITCH: Single analog input is read and if less than Value.LowerBound+BandWidth then True is written to the output value.\X\0D UPPERBANDSWITCH: Single analog input is read and if more than Value.UpperBound-BandWidth then True is written to the output value.\X\0D NOT: Single binary input is read and the opposite value is written to the output value.\X\0D AND: Two binary inputs are read and if both are True then True is written to the output value.\X\0D OR: Two binary inputs are read and if either is True then True is written to the output value.\X\0D XOR: Two binary inputs are read and if one is true then True is written to the output value.\X\0D CALENDAR: No inputs; the current time is compared with an IfcWorkCalendar to which the IfcController is assigned and True is written if active.\X\0D INPUT: Controller element is a dedicated input.\X\0D OUTPUT: Controller element is a dedicated output.\X\0D VARIABLE: Controller element is an in-memory variable.

PropertyDef.Name: Labels
PropertyDef.Definition: Table mapping values to labels, where such labels indicate the meanings of True and False, such as 'Open' and 'Closed'',

PropertyDef.Name: Polarity
PropertyDef.Definition: True indicates normal polarity; False indicates reverse polarity.

PropertyDef.Name: Value
PropertyDef.Definition: The default value such as normally-closed or normally-open.
